items.question: What PDF tools does RevisePDF offer?
items.answer: RevisePDF offers over 20 free PDF tools including compression, conversion (to and from PDF), editing (content, text, watermarks, page numbers), organisation (merge, split, extract, rotate), and security features (encryption, decryption, redaction, flattening). All tools are free to use and require no software installation.

items.question: Is RevisePDF completely free to use?
items.answer: Yes, RevisePDF is currently in beta mode with all features available for free. We plan to implement a subscription model in the future for larger file sizes, but we will always maintain a free tier with generous limits for basic PDF processing needs.

items.question: How secure is RevisePDF for processing my PDF files?
items.answer: RevisePDF takes security seriously. All file transfers are encrypted using HTTPS/TLS, and your files are automatically deleted after processing or after a short period (typically 24 hours). We never share your files with third parties, and our processing happens on secure servers with strict access controls.

items.question: Do I need to create an account to use RevisePDF?
items.answer: No, you can use most of RevisePDF's tools without creating an account. However, creating a free account gives you benefits like higher file size limits, the ability to save your processing history, and access to premium features when they become available.

items.question: What is OCR and why would I need it for my PDFs?
items.answer: OCR (Optical Character Recognition) is a technology that converts scanned documents or images containing text into searchable and editable PDF files. If you have scanned documents, using OCR allows you to search for text within the document, copy text from it, and make the document more accessible for screen readers and other assistive technologies.

about.title: About PDF Compression
about.description: PDF compression reduces the file size of your PDF documents while maintaining acceptable quality. This is useful for sharing documents via email, uploading to websites, or saving storage space.

how_works.title: How It Works
how_works.description: Our compression tool uses a high-quality PDF processing engine to optimise your PDF files. It works by:
points: Downsampling images to reduce their resolution
Applying compression algorithms to images and text
Removing unnecessary metadata and embedded fonts
Optimising the internal structure of the PDF

choosing_level.title: Choosing the Right Compression Level
choosing_level.description: Different compression levels are suitable for different purposes:
points: Screen: Best for documents that will only be viewed on screen
eBook: Good balance between quality and file size, suitable for most purposes
Printer: Better quality for documents that will be printed
Prepress: High quality with colour preservation for professional printing

about.info: The actual compression ratio depends on the content of your PDF. Documents with many images will see greater reduction than text-only documents.
